text.p: Cement and building materials group Holderbank Financiere Glaris AG said on Monday it was launching a sponsored Level 1 American Depositary Receipts (ADR) programme, effective immediately.
Holderbank said in a statement the ADRs would enable new categories of U.S. investors to acquire its existing bearer stock through a U.S. dollar denominated security.
"A Level 1 ADR does not entail the issuance of new bearer shares, only the creation of U.S. dollar certificates on existing Holderbank bearer shares," it added.
It said the Bank of New York was the depositary and transfer agent.
Holderbank said U.S. investors who had been barred by their own by-laws of for other reasons from buying Holderbank shares directly on the Swiss Exchange could now buy ADRs.

It said the ADR offered advantages to U.S. investors over directly holding Swiss shares, including convenience, cost, enhanced liquidity, easier share transfers and dividend collection and payment in U.S. dollars.
Holderbank is the world's biggest supplier of cement, aggregates, ready-mixed concrete and concrete chemicals as well as construction-related services.
